channel.title: Posts on Dominic Minischetti
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dominic Minischetti

item.title: The Silent Commit
item.description: A love letter to invisible work, those cleanups, tweaks, and tiny decisions that make life better for the next developer, even if no one sees them.

item.title: Coding Without a Second Monitor: On Limits, Focus, and Small Screens
item.description: What if working with less screen space made you a better developer?

item.title: When the Bot Is Your Pair: 7 Team Rituals That Make AI Coding Agents Actually Work
item.description: Beyond the Copilot demo, what it takes to actually live with an AI pair-programmer in real codebases.

item.title: When Junior Developers Teach Me the Most
item.description: A few good questions from someone new can sometimes rewire everything you thought you knew.

item.title: PHP 8.4 Isn’t Just 'Another Minor': Property Hooks & Asymmetric Visibility for Real Apps
item.description: How PHP 8.4’s quiet features radically reshape everyday code, and help your models finally behave like themselves.

item.title: Docs That Run, Answer, and Prove: Turning Documentation into a Living Interface
item.description: What happens when docs stop describing the product and start behaving like part of it.

item.title: Backend Engineering as Invisible Design
item.description: The user never sees your code, but they feel every millisecond of it.

item.title: Branch Your Database, Not Your Luck: How Serverless SQL + Preview DBs Change Shipping
item.description: No more staging chaos, flaky QA, or data déjà vu, database branching finally brings dev envs into the modern age.

item.title: When Data Lies Honestly
item.description: A moment in analysis where the numbers were right, but the question was wrong.

item.title: Document Your APIs Like You're Explaining Them to Your Kid
item.description: A case for clarity over cleverness in API documentation, because your future self deserves kindness.

item.title: Notes Apps Are Becoming Operating Systems
item.description: Living inside Notion, Obsidian, and AI for a month made me rethink what 'apps' even are.

item.title: Queries as a Form of Self-Reflection
item.description: Every SQL query is a guess about reality, a way of turning uncertainty into something shaped, countable, and sometimes quietly revealing.

item.title: The Things I Learned Staring at a Log at 2 A.M.
item.description: A quiet night of debugging that slowly became a conversation with the system, not a battle.

item.title: The Kindest Apps Are Local-First: CRDTs, Sync Anxiety, and Why SQLite Won 2025
item.description: In 2025, building fast feels nice. Building local-first feels humane.

item.title: The File Everyone's Afraid to Touch
item.description: Legacy code isn’t just old, it’s haunted. But someone has to open the door.

item.title: Systems Thinking for Parenthood, Pasta, and PHP
item.description: Turns out the way you debug your code might look a lot like how you raise your kid or cook your dinner.

item.title: Readable Code Is a Love Letter to the Future
item.description: Code isn’t just a technical artifact, it’s a message to someone else’s tired brain.
